summary: This document is an email chain from July 23, 2020, regarding a FOIA request in the Epstein matter. An Associate Warden at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York is being asked to confirm the location of documentation related to Epstein, and the warden indicates they have saved documentation on a hard drive that is too large to send in one email.

persons.name: Associate Warden MCC New York
persons.role: Associate Warden at Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York
persons.context: The recipient of an email inquiry regarding documentation for a FOIA request related to Epstein. They indicate they have saved documentation on their hard drive.

events.title: FOIA Request Inquiry
events.description: An email inquiry is made to an Associate Warden at MCC New York regarding documentation for a FOIA request in the Epstein matter.

events.title: Epstein Incident
events.description: Reference to an 'incident last year' involving Epstein, likely his death in custody.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: A FOIA request was made regarding Jeffrey Epstein in July 2020.
An Associate Warden at MCC New York had saved documentation related to Epstein on a hard drive, which was described as 'too large to send in 1 email'.
The warden had previously received a litigation hold 'soon after the incident last year', referring to Epstein's death in 2019.
The email seeks confirmation that no other physical or electronic documentation exists beyond what was in the warden's email and MCC hard drive.
The correspondence indicates an effort to gather and centralize records related to Epstein's incarceration and death for a FOIA response.
